dimensions.name: error_resolution_duration
dimensions.description: Time in minutes from first error-related search to apparent resolution (last related search before topic change or extended break)
dimensions.how_to_measure: Identify debugging sessions by searches containing error keywords (error, exception, bug, fix, debug, stacktrace, issue). For each session, record the timestamp of the first error-related search and the last related search before a topic change or >30 min gap. Compute duration in minutes.
dimensions._changed: Added explicit units (minutes) and clarified measurement procedure

dimensions.name: search_iterations
dimensions.description: Number of search queries performed during a debugging session before resolution, indicating search efficiency
dimensions.how_to_measure: For each identified debugging session, count the number of [search] entries from session start to resolution.

dimensions.name: technical_search_count
dimensions.description: Daily count of searches and visits related to technical programming topics, indicating engagement with technology
dimensions.how_to_measure: Count searches and page visits related to programming topics (languages, frameworks, libraries, tools, documentation sites, technical concepts) for each day.
dimensions._changed: Renamed from prior_technology_exposure; removed 14-day lookback (global dependency); simplified to daily count; lagged edge handles temporal accumulation

dimensions.name: debugging_start_hour
dimensions.description: Hour of day (0-23) when debugging sessions start, capturing circadian effects on performance
dimensions.how_to_measure: For each debugging session, record the hour (0-23) extracted from the timestamp of the first error-related search. Scale: 0=midnight, 12=noon, 23=11pm.
dimensions._changed: Renamed from hour_of_day; changed measurement_granularity to finest (session-level); clarified scale

dimensions.name: topic_category
dimensions.description: Topic cluster of each search, used to measure context switching via topic diversity
dimensions.how_to_measure: Categorize each search into one topic: crypto_security, functional_programming, ruby_rails, web_frontend, databases, devops_infra, food, travel, music, entertainment, other_technical, other_leisure.
dimensions._changed: Renamed from daily_topic_switches; changed dtype to categorical, aggregation to n_unique; workers classify searches, aggregation counts distinct categories

dimensions.name: is_official_doc
dimensions.description: Whether a URL visited during debugging is official documentation vs community forum
dimensions.how_to_measure: For each URL visited during a debugging session, code 1 if official documentation (official language/framework sites, GitHub docs, technical wikis, vendor documentation) or 0 if community source (StackOverflow, Reddit, HackerNews, personal blogs, forums).
dimensions._changed: Renamed from documentation_quality_ratio; changed dtype to binary, aggregation to sum; ratio computation removed from how_to_measure

dimensions.name: leisure_activity_count
dimensions.description: Count of non-technical browsing activities indicating breaks and mental rest
dimensions.how_to_measure: Count searches and visits related to leisure topics (music, food, travel, entertainment, social media, shopping, sports, news) for each hour.
dimensions._changed: Renamed from recent_break_duration; changed to count dtype (duration unreliable without page close times); removed '2 hours before debugging' dependency; aggregated hourly

dimensions.name: debugging_sessions_today
dimensions.description: Number of distinct debugging sessions on a given day, indicating debugging workload
dimensions.how_to_measure: Count distinct debugging sessions for each day. A session is a cluster of searches containing error keywords (error, exception, bug, debug, stacktrace, fix) separated by >30 minutes or unrelated activity from other clusters.
dimensions._changed: Renamed from prior_debugging_sessions_today; changed aggregation to sum; removed 'prior to current' concept (required global context)

dimensions.name: learning_activity_count
dimensions.description: Count of technical learning activities (not debugging), indicating knowledge building
dimensions.how_to_measure: Count visits to technical learning content: tutorials, documentation exploration, concept research (e.g., Haskell monads, cryptography theory, language features) that are NOT part of a debugging session (not preceded by error-related searches within 10 minutes).
dimensions._changed: Renamed from learning_intensity_yesterday; changed to count dtype (minutes unreliable); removed 'yesterday' from measurement (lagged edge handles this)

dimensions.name: initial_query_technical_terms
dimensions.description: Count of technical/specific terms in the first search query of a debugging session
dimensions.how_to_measure: For the first search in each debugging session, count technical terms: programming language names, framework names, function/method names, error codes, library names, specific concepts. Record integer count (typical range 0-8).
dimensions._changed: Renamed from first_search_specificity; simplified to pure count of technical terms; dtype continuous (for mean aggregation); added typical range

dimensions.name: error_domain_familiarity
dimensions.description: Latent familiarity and expertise with the specific error domain, shaped by exposure and learning

dimensions.name: cognitive_efficiency
dimensions.description: Latent cognitive state affecting information processing speed, focus, and problem-solving ability

dimensions.name: search_strategy_quality
dimensions.description: Latent quality of debugging search approach - knowing what to search, where to look, how to refine

dimensions.name: is_weekend
dimensions.description: Whether the day is a weekend (Saturday or Sunday)
dimensions.how_to_measure: From the date, code 1 if Saturday or Sunday, 0 if weekday.

dimensions.name: activity_gap_hours
dimensions.description: Hours since last browsing activity when debugging session starts, indicating fresh start vs continuous work
dimensions.how_to_measure: For each debugging session, calculate time elapsed (in hours, e.g., 0.5 for 30 min) from the timestamp of the most recent prior browsing activity to the first error-related search. Record 0 if gap is under 5 minutes.
dimensions._changed: Renamed from session_gap_hours; changed measurement_granularity to finest; clarified units and edge case

edges.description: More exposure to technical topics builds familiarity with error patterns and solutions
Technical learning expands knowledge base and deepens understanding of concepts
Greater familiarity enables faster pattern recognition of errors and known solutions
Domain expertise helps formulate better search queries and know where to find answers
High topic diversity (many distinct categories) depletes working memory and reduces efficiency
Circadian rhythms affect alertness and cognitive performance throughout the day
Mental breaks allow cognitive recovery, reduce fatigue, and improve subsequent focus
Accumulated debugging workload depletes mental resources and increases fatigue
Starting fresh after a break vs continuous work affects mental sharpness
Weekend debugging may have different cognitive context - either more relaxed or less focused
Higher cognitive efficiency enables faster information processing and problem solving
Better cognitive state leads to more thoughtful, strategic search behavior
Better search strategy leads to more efficient queries and fewer iterations needed
Good strategy manifests in more specific, targeted initial search queries
Skilled debuggers know to prioritize official documentation over forums
More specific initial queries find relevant results faster, reducing resolution time
More search iterations extend the debugging session duration
Official documentation typically provides more accurate, authoritative solutions faster
Domain knowledge enables more precise error query formulation from the start
